support_summary: The deubiquitinase USP10 interacts with TDP-43 and facilitates the disassembly of TDP-43-positive stress granules (SGs). This function is critical for preventing the transition of transient SGs into persistent, pathological cytoplasmic aggregates of TDP-43, a hallmark of TDP-43 proteinopathies.

functions.cellular_process: USP10, a deubiquitinase that localizes to stress granules (SGs), interacts with TDP-43 and the core SG protein G3BP1. It facilitates the timely clearance and disassembly of TDP-43-positive SGs following the removal of cellular stress.
functions.effect_description: USP10 promotes the resolution of TDP-43-positive stress granules, thereby inhibiting the formation of stable, pathological cytoplasmic TDP-43 aggregates.
biological_consequence: Cellular stress → TDP-43 is recruited to cytoplasmic Stress Granules (SGs) → USP10 deubiquitinates SG components (e.g., G3BP1) → Timely disassembly of SGs upon stress removal → TDP-43 returns to the nucleus → Restoration of cellular homeostasis

USP10 dysfunction or depletion → Impaired SG disassembly → Prolonged cytoplasmic retention of TDP-43 in SGs → Liquid-to-solid phase transition of TDP-43 → Formation of insoluble, pathological aggregates → Neurodegeneration
specific_effects: USP10 promotes the clearance of TDP-43-positive SGs, thereby inhibiting the formation of aberrant cytoplasmic TDP-43 aggregates. [3, 4]
Depletion of USP10 increases the amount of insoluble TDP-35, a toxic C-terminal fragment of TDP-43. [3, 4]
USP10 controls multiple aspects of TDP-43 biology, including its aggregation, expression, and splicing functionality. [2, 17]
USP10 protein levels are inversely correlated with the pathological burden of TDP-43 in postmortem human motor neurons. [2]

evidence.paper_title: USP10 Inhibits Aberrant Cytoplasmic Aggregation of TDP-43 by Promoting Stress Granule Clearance
evidence.authors: Takahashi M, Kitaura H, Kakita A, Kakihana T, Katsuragi Y, Onodera O, Iwakura Y, Nawa H, Komatsu M, Fujii M
evidence.relevant_quote: Our findings suggest that USP10 inhibits aberrant aggregation of TDP-43/TDP-35 in the cytoplasm of neuronal cells by promoting the clearance of TDP-43/TDP-35-positive SGs... [3]

evidence.paper_title: Functional implication of ubiquitinating and deubiquitinating mechanisms in TDP-43 proteinopathies
evidence.journal: Frontiers in Cell and Developmental Biology
evidence.relevant_quote: E3 ubiquitin ligases coupled with deubiquitinating enzymes may influence the TDP-43-associated proteotoxicity through diverse events, such as protein stability, translocation, and stress granule or inclusion formation. [14]

mechanism: USP10, a deubiquitinase that localizes to stress granules (SGs), interacts with TDP-43 and the core SG protein G3BP1. It facilitates the timely clearance and disassembly of TDP-43-positive SGs following the removal of cellular stress.
effect: USP10 promotes the resolution of TDP-43-positive stress granules, thereby inhibiting the formation of stable, pathological cytoplasmic TDP-43 aggregates.
summary: TDP43 activates USP10 to modulate stress granule clearance, ultimately affecting restoration of cellular homeostasis.

evidence.paper_title: USP10 Inhibits Aberrant Cytoplasmic Aggregation of TDP-43 by Promoting Stress Granule Clearance
evidence.authors: Takahashi M, Kitaura H, Kakita A, Kakihana T, Katsuragi Y, Onodera O, Iwakura Y, Nawa H, Komatsu M, Fujii M
evidence.relevant_quote: Our findings suggest that USP10 inhibits aberrant aggregation of TDP-43/TDP-35 in the cytoplasm of neuronal cells by promoting the clearance of TDP-43/TDP-35-positive SGs... [3]

evidence.paper_title: A functional interaction between TDP-43 and USP10 reveals USP10 dysfunction in TDP-43 proteinopathies
evidence.authors: Marrero-Gagliardi A, Noda J, Zanovello M, Brito Armas JM, Bampton A, Torres P, Pérez Hernández C, Fumagallo F, Taoro L, Muñoz de Bustillo Alfaro R, Brown AL, Quinet G, Andrés-Benito P, Ferrer I, Acebes A, Freire R, Smits VAJ, Keuss M, Portero-Otin M, Lashley T, Fratta P, Acevedo-Arozena A
evidence.relevant_quote: Here, we identified a new functional interaction between TDP-43 and USP10, in which USP10 can control multiple aspects of TDP-43 biology... such as its cytoplasmic and nuclear aggregation, expression and splicing functionality. [17]

evidence.paper_title: Functional implication of ubiquitinating and deubiquitinating mechanisms in TDP-43 proteinopathies
evidence.journal: Frontiers in Cell and Developmental Biology
